thread.title: 3 things to do in New Castle County this weekend
thread.title_full: 3 things to do in New Castle County this weekend

author: Andre Lamar andre.lamar@doverpost.com @302DoAndre
title: 3 things to do in New Castle County this weekend
text: 3 things to do in New Castle County this weekend Here are three things to do in New Castle County this weekend. Comment @302DoAndre Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 4:55 pm Updated Oct 14, 2015 at 4:59 PM CRAIG FERGUSON 1. Craig Ferguson tickled audiences with his sharp humor on his namesake late-night show on CBS, from 2005 to 2014, earning an Emmy nomination and a Peabody Award. His eclectic career, however, isn’t limited to just hosting a late show, as Ferguson has also dabbled in film and on stage. On the big screen he reprised his role as Gobber the Viking in “How to Train Your Dragon 2.” Now on tour with a standup show titled “The New Deal,” Ferguson is headed to amuse the audience at The Playhouse in Wilmington on Sunday. IF YOU GO WHERE The Playhouse, 1007 N. Market St., Wilmington COST $40 to $79.40 INFO Visit duponttheatre.comor call 888-0200 HAGLEY CRAFT FAIR 2. You might be able to find some stylish crafts to decorate your home, office desk and more at the Hagley Craft Fair in Wilmington on Saturday and Sunday. The fair, held at Hagley Museum and Library, brings talented artisans from the Mid-Atlantic area to display and sell fine arts, crafts and gourmet items. Folks will find items in media including wood, pottery, jewelry, fibers and metal. The fair will include a specialty food market as well. IF YOU GO WHEN 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., Saturday; 10 to 4 p.m., Sunday WHERE Hagley Museum and Library, 298 Buck Road East, Wilmington COST $5; free for members and children age 5 or younger INFO Visit hagley.org or call 658-2400 SHEER MAG CONCERT 3. One of RollingStone.com’s top bands of the year is headed to the Arden Gild Hall this weekend. The band Sheer Mag, comprised of punk and rock ‘n’ roll elements, is respected on the underground scene and has also been gaining national attention from news outlets such as Pitchfork. Sheer and their bring-the-noise personality will headline the concert in Arden, with Dead Heavens as the opener. IF YOU GO WHERE Arden Gild Hall, 2126 The Highway, Arden COST $13; $10 members
